intro: Hieracium pleicephalum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium pleicephalum is known for its robust growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
